snippet: The agreement was part of a settlement of a lawsuit accusing the authorities of unlawfully forcing their way into the homes of Latino families on Long Island and in Westchester County.
abstract: Federal authorities agree to establish new policies governing conduct of immigration officers during raids, including restrictions on how and when agents can enter private homes; agreement is part of a settlement of a six-year-old class action lawsuit accusing authorities of unlawfully forcing their way into the homes of Latino families in New York metropolitan area.
lead_paragraph: The agreement was part of a settlement of a lawsuit accusing the authorities of unlawfully forcing their way into the homes of Latino families on Long Island and in Westchester County.

headline.seo: U.S. Agrees to Set New Rules for Immigration Raids
